methods.name: getName
methods.summary: Get the name of this item. This is only the simple name (with extension part) under the path.

returnType.summary: True if the item was successfully created.
True if the item was successfully deleted.

methods.name: getPath
methods.summary: Get the absolute path of this item. This doesn't include the name.

methods.name: exists
methods.summary: Whether this item exist on file system.

returnType.summary: True if the item is a file; false a directory.

methods.name: isFile
methods.summary: Whether this item is a file

name: Item
summary:
A file system item. Can be a file or directory.

When using this and other FS APIs, it's common to deal with paths. Unless noted, a path can be either absolute or relative (to working directory of the current process). A path comprises of one or more sections, and in case of relative path the path can be even empty. These section are separated by a path separator, which can differ based on the OS. However, Julian recognizes both '/' (POSIX) and '\' (Windows) as the equally legal path separator.
